translation: Attachment and aversion for the objects of the senses abide in the senses; let no one come under their sway; for, they are his enemies.
commentary: 3.34 sense of sense of each sense? in the sense in the object? Ragadveshau attachment and aversion? seated in the system? of these two? Not not? Vasham sway? Agachchet should come under? So these two? Hi verily? his his? paripanthinau foes.Commentary Each sense has got attraction for a pleasant object and aversion for a disagreeable object. If one can control these two currents? viz.? attachment and aversion?
